title: Michigan Teen Gets Life in Prison for Oxford High School Attack
description: A judge sentenced a Michigan teen to life in prison for killing four students at Oxford High School.

title: Breaking Down Taylor Swift’s 2023 Impact By the Numbers
description: The past year has seen Swift reach new and often unprecedented levels of success, by both traditional and novel measures.

title: COP28 Is a Business Bonanza. Should It Be?
description: COP28 participants are having to grapple with the question of whether, and how, corporations fit into the annual climate talks.

title: University of Pennsylvania Loses $100 Million Donation After School President’s Remarks in Congress
description: The University of Pennsylvania has lost $100 million in funding after the school’s president testified about antisemitism on college campuses during a Congressional hearing on Tuesday.

title: Hanukkah and the Miracle of Resistance
description: This Hanukkah, human solidarity must be front and center, writes Stefanie Fox.

title: The White House’s Latest Move to Rein in Drug Prices
description: Drug companies use tax-payer money to develop drugs and sell them at high prices. The White House says it’s going to make this stop.

title: FDA Approves First CRISPR Treatment in U.S.
description: Two new therapies—one which uses the gene-editing technology—treat sickle cell anemia.

title: Finding Common Ground Between Israelis and Palestinians
description: "You can’t ask Israel to commit national suicide, though you can demand it recognize Palestinian rights."

title: With the Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Over, Agony Continues for Hostage Families
description: The end of a temporary ceasefire devastated families of the hostages who remain in Gaza.

title: Hunter Biden Claims Republicans Are Trying to ‘Kill’ Him to Undermine Father’s Presidency
description: “They’re trying to destroy a presidency,” Hunter Biden said in a podcast with musician Moby released Friday.

title: The U.K. Government Is Facing Pushback to Its Rwanda Migrant Plan. Here’s What to Know
description: The U.K. government's proposed Rwanda migrant plan has encountered repeated setbacks and legal challenges.

title: Ukraine Aid From U.S. Congress Under Threat After Failed Senate Vote. What Happens Next?
description: Republicans in the Senate voted unanimously to block an emergency spending bill that would have provided $110.5 billion to Ukraine, Israel and other security needs.

title: The 10 Best Fiction Books of 2023
description: See which novels and short story collections made TIME's list.

title: ‘Atoms for Peace’ Was Never All That Peaceful—And the World Is Still Living With the Consequences
description: The U.S. sought to rebrand nuclear power as a source of peace, but this message helped mask a violent history.

title: Microsoft’s OpenAI Ties Face Potential U.K. Antitrust Probe
description: Microsoft’s partnership with OpenAI is facing the potential of a full-blown U.K. antitrust investigation.

title: Bidenomics Is Real Economics
description: Bidenomics will improve America's economic and political future, argues Nick Hanauer.

title: The Obvious Solution to Loss-and-Damage Fund Distribution
description: How to effectively distribute climate loss-and-damage funds is a key question at the COP28 meeting in Dubai. Yolande Wright has the answer.

title: Putin to Seek Another Presidential Term in Russia, Extending Rule of Over Two Decades
description: Vladimir Putin on Friday moved to prolong his unyielding grip on Russia, announcing his candidacy in the presidential election next March.

title: Ivy League Presidents Try to Clarify Stances on Antisemitism After Backlash to Testimony
description: The heads of Harvard and the University of Pennsylvania were forced to issue statements clarifying their responses to a U.S. congressional hearing on antisemitism after a barrage of criticism from business leaders and politicians.

title: Hunter Biden Faces 9 New Criminal Charges. Here’s What to Know
description: The 56-page indictment detailing tax-related charges against President Joe Biden’s 53-year-old son includes three felony counts.
